column1: Art Institute of Chicago////And if you climb on them
column2: an alarm goes off.  Not a regular alarm
column3: but an electronic lion roaring sound played over and over again.  And then a guard comes running out of the building and down the steps and is like
column4: "Hey! Get off the lion!".  And when nobody is on the lion he's like "what ?!?" and then is like  "nobody better get on that lion".    The roaring lion alarm is set off easily I think.  Maybe it was pigeons or the wind.  Although I can see the guards point of view too.  Teenagers are a problem everywhere.   You have to stay vigilant or they'll run rampant.
